meanings.sent1: The wind dissipates the leaves across the yard.
meanings.sent2: After the party, the crowd dissipates into smaller groups.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was to dissipate the cards in all directions.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to dissipate into the air like bubbles.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a fan to dissipate the smoke during the experiment.

meanings.sent1: The morning mist dissipates as the sun rises.
meanings.sent2: His hopes for a promotion slowly dissipate as the year goes on.
meanings.sent3: The mystery surrounding the old house seemed to dissipate overnight.
meanings.sent4: The music from the party dissipates into the night.
meanings.sent5: The scent of fresh flowers dissipates quickly in the open air.

meanings.sent1: He dissipates his money on unnecessary gadgets.
meanings.sent2: She tends to dissipate her energy on trivial matters.
meanings.sent3: The company's resources were dissipating due to poor management.
meanings.sent4: Don't dissipate your talent on things that don't matter.
meanings.sent5: The water seemed to dissipate down the drain without purpose.

meanings.sent1: The long hike dissipates all my energy by the end.
meanings.sent2: The intense workout routine dissipates his strength quickly.
meanings.sent3: The demanding project dissipates her time and focus.
meanings.sent4: The marathon race will dissipate his stamina in no time.
meanings.sent5: The constant stress at work dissipates her mental resilience.
